snippet: Five justices voted to eliminate sensible contribution limits to federal campaigns, giving those few people with the most money the loudest voice in politics.
abstract: Editorial decries Supreme Court decision eliminating long-established contribution limits to federal political campaigns; notes under new ruling, individual donors may contribute $3.6 million per election cycle; holds ruling is less about free speech, as claimed by Chief Justice John Roberts Jr, than about giving few people with most money loudest voice in politics.
lead_paragraph: Five justices voted to eliminate sensible contribution limits to federal campaigns, giving those few people with the most money the loudest voice in politics.

keywords.value: McCutcheon v Federal Election Commission (Supreme Court Decision)
keywords.name: subject
